dialogue.text: You're wondering what the chart autosave option is for?
I'll explain to the best of my abilities.
By default, Psych Engine saves your work when you press ENTER, ESCAPE, or BACK-\nSPACE in the chart editor. This autosave
is stored in your game save data, which means if you click the Load Autosave button in the chart editor, your previous work gets
loaded and you can resume from where you left off.
If you have this option enabled, though, I'll do some magic to get your autosave loaded when you open the chart editor from the
Editors menu, as long as you haven't played a song before then.
If you play a song before opening the Editors menu, this option will be ignored regardless and your last played song will be loaded
in the editor. A similar thing also applies if you have no autosaved chart and you're opening the chart editor for the first time.
Anyway, I hope this option may come in handy if you use the chart editor a lot!
Let me know if you have any other questions.
